instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board on my bench which is restarting randomly, showing "Your computer restarted because of a problem..." message. Board was water damaged in the past, cleaned by other shop. Now it has no signs of corossion or damaged components, looks fine. It starts, sometimes boots to the system, but mostly restarts on progress bar. When I want to run system from USB it is loading OS very long and only once booted to High Sierra, rest of the time it just restarts or hang somewhere in the end of progress bar. I have tested it with everything disconnected from the board, with new SSD, without SSD connected, with new I/O flex, new trackpad flex - always behaves the same way. I can't even boot to OS installer. I have already reflashed BIOS with known good file with clean ME region (from this forum) and resoldered SMC. Sadly no changes. Any ideas? I suspect PCH or CPU problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message: You may have corrosion underneath CPU, or RAM chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message: Tomorrow i will reheat them with flux and post results.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message: It seems, that reflowing RAM chips did the trick, computer works fine, installs OS and boots normally. Thank you, [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message: It was working fine for one day and came back to previous state - restarting randomly, doesn't load or install OS..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message:
You can try to change RAM chips, or reball them at least.
Be aware, te problem can be on CPU side...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarting randomly
threads.message: I think it's CPU problem, customer decided that we will replace motherboard, I will keep this one for components or future repair.
